answers.answer: Well, I am not 100% sure, but, it could mean they saw a few areas that look suspiscious regarding the rythm or the tracing in general. Some doctors are more careful than others, so, try not to worry, but, DO discuss it with the prescribing doctor and find out just the reason why.Also, if you have any other heart issues, they may want to be more vigilant as well. It just depends.Susie

I think you will be less anxious if you know what your doctor is referring to.  Why not give the office and call and speak to the doctor.  Or, if you need to schedule a follow up so you can talk in person.  You can also request a copy of the test results (might be a good point of reference). Why did you have the monitor?

I had the monitor as I have been experiencing dizziness for the last month and am diabetic but my sugers have been fine.  I have blockages in my neck and the last time they were checked, the blockages weren't bad enough for surgery.  Apparently they have to be at a certain percentage.  Also, heart attacks, blockages, and diabetes is very big in my family history

question: What does it mean when you dr. says your holter monitor test results came back borderline and I need to watch you
title: holter monitor test results
